704426f-a.text:
(1)
Fort Hamilton Parkway, at the N.W. corner of 99th Street, showing St. John's Episcopal Church and a double frame house (Nos. 9808-9810). The church was organized in this community in the farmhouse of one Denyse, at the N.E. corner of Fort Hamilton Parkway and 101st Street, on September 29, 1834. The Denyse heirs reserved a 1ot (100' x 125') the present site, on which a frame building was erected. It was consecrated on July 16, 1835. On Dec. 24, 1890 this building was partly burned, resulting in its demolition and the erecting of the present one in 1897, which was consecrated on danuary 5, 1898.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing the chapel belonging to the church which is part1y seen at the extreme left in No. 1.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704426f-a.folder: Fort Hamilton Parkway & 99th Street, Brooklyn, NY

702941f-b.text:
(1)
419-433 99th Street, north side, between Fort Hamilton Parkway and Fourth Ave. The buildings concerned are frame homes.
May 1O, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle, showing a close-up of the frame
house at No. 431-99th Street.
June 9, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
